value.title: Developers have made $550B on Apple’s App Store since 2008
value.content: Apple says its services had a "record-breaking year," as Apple TV, Apple Music, and Apple Pay also soared.

value.title: Meta hires former Trump advisor Dina Powell McCormick as president and vice chair
value.content: Powell McCormick served as deputy national security advisor to President Donald Trump.

value.title: inDrive turns to ads and groceries to diversify revenue
value.content: Advertising on inDrive is being rolled out across its top 20 markets following mid-2025 tests.

value.title: Instagram says there’s been ‘no breach’ despite password reset requests
value.content: Instagram says that although some users received suspicious-looking password reset requests, it has not been breached.

value.title: Disney+ is launching short-form videos this year
value.content: The move comes as Disney launched a personalized vertical video feed in the ESPN app last year.

value.title: Gmail debuts a personalized AI Inbox, AI Overviews in search, and more
value.content: Gmail is also bringing several AI features that were previously available only to paid users to all users.

value.title: Skylight debuts Calendar 2 to keep your family organized
value.content: Skylight, known for its digital picture frame, has a new digital product that puts software and AI at the center.

value.title: WhatsApp rolls out new group chat features, including member tags
value.content: You can choose a tag that gives others in the group chat more context about who you are.

value.title: Spotify now lets you share what you’re streaming in real time with friends
value.content: You can tap a friend’s listening activity to play the track, save it, open the menu, or react with an emoji.

value.title: Spotify lowers monetization threshold for video podcasts
value.content: Spotify is dropping the minimum episode requirement to three, minimum consumption hours to 2,000, and engaged audience member threshold to 1,000 over the last 30 days.

value.title: Roblox now requires all users globally to complete age checks to access chat
value.content: Once users complete an age check, they can access age-based chat, which means they can only communicate with others in a similar age group.

value.title: Threads is developing in-message games
value.content: Launching in-message games would give Threads an edge over competitors like X and Bluesky, which don’t offer built-in games.
